title: No to the construction of a new Neil Cowan building in Surrey
body:
The current plan for a new Neil Cowan building in Surrey is a disgrace. The building will cost the taxpayers billions of pounds which will not be used for jobs.

The taxpayer pounds will be spent on the demolition of the building and for the repair of the demolition of the building.

The government will use the money to build a new Neil Cowan building that will not be used.

This should not be allowed to happen in a community where there is a high crime rate.

This will affect the future of the area. The building is an iconic building.

title: Ensure that the UK government and UK Parliament have all the powers they require to enact the Brexit deal.
body:
The UK government has been forced to pass a law that ensures that any Brexit deal that is passed by Parliament, will not be binding. We the undersigned believe that the Brexit deal must be enacted by the UK government in the best interests of the people of the UK.
It cannot be enacted without the full support of the UK Parliament.
